abstract: The Italian bank says it could get along without the cash, but wants to stay competitive with other banks that are getting bailouts.
snippet: The Italian bank says it could get along without the cash, but wants to stay competitive with other banks that are getting bailouts.
lead_paragraph: UniCredit, one of the biggest Italian banks, said Wednesday that it would seek new government funds, and analysts at JPMorgan Chase predicted that Deutsche Bank would need billions more in capital, the latest signs that European financial institutions were continuing to struggle.

headline.main: Bank to Ask Italy and Austria for $5.2 Billion
headline.print_headline: Bank to Ask Italy and Austria for $5.2 Billion
